basics.name: Tyler Burnett
basics.label: Nutrition and Health Promotion
basics.summary:
Dedicated professional with a focus on data, nutrition, and health promotion, adept at creating data-driven insights. I find innovative solutions to complex challenges in health and beyond. I have always been deeply fascinated by the intricate workings of the human body and the ways in which we can optimize our health and well-being. My passion for learning drives me to delve into the science of human physiology, seeking innovative methods or 'biohacks' to enhance our quality of life. This pursuit is not just academic; it's personal, as I believe in empowering individuals to live their best lives by understanding and nurturing the vessel we inhabit.

Through my studies, I aim to uncover and share knowledge that allows us to take proactive steps towards health, vitality, and longevity, making the journey of self-care both enlightening and empowering.

work.summary: Ensuring Medical Rediness in the MSNG.
highlights: Instrumental in the Army Health Promotion Program, designing and implementing wellness initiatives that resulted in a 25% increase in physical fitness test pass rates among soldiers, directly impacting unit morale and combat effectiveness.
Ensured medical rediness but completing 11,000 physical health exams for the MSNG.
Provided medical support for 3,000 soldiers during the COVID-19 pandemic, including testing, contact tracing, and vaccination administration.
Effefctively taught classes on field Sanitation, preventive medicine, and nutrition to over 50 soldiers, ensuring they were prepared for field training and deployment.

work.summary: Served and educated customers on health and wellness products.
highlights: Evaluated uniqued nutrient and energy requirements for each patient based on BMI, lifestyle and individual medical issues.
Provided guidance on healthy eating habits and the use of supplements.

Achieved top sales performance by tailoring personalized supplement regimens, increasing customer satisfaction and boosting repeat business through expert nutritional guidance and product knowledge at GNC.

volunteer.summary: Engaging with fraternities and sorotities to promote healthier lifestyles through nutrition and lifestyle.
highlights: Enhanced awareness and understanding of nutrition's role in physical and mental health.
Provided resources and guidance to help students make healthier choices.

references.name: Dr. Mandy Conrad at Mississippi State University
references.reference: A student who has truly stood out in my class not just for their academic prowess but for their ability to bring joy and laughter into the learning environment.
